attributes.action: Re-open the Dubs scheme to allow unaccompanied child refugees entry into the UK
attributes.background: The Government announced in February that it would close the Dubs scheme – intended to grant 3000 vulnerable unaccompanied minors a safe passage to Britain – after accepting just 350. We are capable of taking thousands more. Sign to call for the scheme to be reopened & help these desperate children.
attributes.additional_details: FOI requests have shown that local councils have voluntarily offered to accept 1572 more children than are currently being supported, yet the Government is refusing to accept any more child refugees from the continent. The longer this goes on the more likely it is that children will go missing & fall into the hands of traffickers. Our values of openness & tolerance mean that we have a duty to be a land of sanctuary to these vulnerable children. The Government must act now and re-open the scheme.

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting rules to prevent voter fraud
attributes.background: At the moment anyone can apply for a postal vote. The Government should change the way postal votes are allowed. Only people who are seriously ill or out of the country on holiday or business should be allowed to have them.
attributes.additional_details: Postal Votes are open to widespread abuse. The Government should change the rules to prevent systemic postal vote abuse.

attributes.action: Provide full or part government funding for all UK air ambulance services
attributes.background: Air ambulances across the UK are saving thousands of lies every year and all are completely reliant on charity contributions.  This is an unacceptable and unreliable state to be in and government funding should be provided

attributes.action: Cut the "Aid budget" to other countries and use it to help our struggling NHS
attributes.background:
Our £13 Billion Aid budget needs to be cut for our struggling NHS. 
The NHS are struggling for staff, beds and resources to keep up with the growing demand. The NHS needs to be updated; with up to date systems/policies. 
Funding needs to be put into education, new staff and a important pay rise.
attributes.additional_details:
References- 

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/07/17/government-departments-struggling-spend-foreign-aid-budgets/amp/

attributes.action: Support Kurdistan independence from Iraq
attributes.background: Oppose any and all threats, use of force, blockades, restrictions of movement and other attempts to intimidate the Kurds into submission to tyranny.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Unequivocally support the Kurdish people in Iraq.
2. Oppose any and all threats, use of force, blockades, restrictions of movement and other attempts to intimidate the Kurds into submission to tyranny.
3. Provide every encouragement and assistance for the peaceful establishment of an independent, sovereign and free Kurdish state.

attributes.action: Law change to waive impound and storage fees of stolen recovered vehicles.
attributes.background: Why are victims of theft paying for return of their stolen vehicles? It's legalised robbery.

attributes.action: Increase the speed limit on motorways from 70mph to 80mph by 2022.
attributes.background: Speed limits on motorways need updating and speed cameras while there to provide a critically important deterrent stop drivers from going faster on a clear stretch of road. By increasing the speed limit on our motorways drivers would legally reduce travel time and make road travel more productive.

attributes.action: Compulsory labelling of recyclability on all products
attributes.background: Many products don't explicitly state whether or not they are recyclable. This creates a lot of confusion and results in recyclable items being put in normal waste bins, which is detrimental to the environment. If non-recyclable items are wrongly disposed of, they can disrupt the recycling process.

attributes.action: RAF should provide cover for Air cadet squadrons if CO is unfit for duty
attributes.background: Our squadron (2391 parkstone) has been temporarily suspended due to our CO being unfit for duty. At our squadron, the suspension is affecting us deeply. We believe that we should get to run temporarily with all members of staff (e.g. warrant officer) whilst waiting for a replacement.

attributes.action: Ban the use of glitter and save our marine life!
attributes.background:
Tops Day Nurseries have made a pledge to become more sustainable and have recently discovered an unexpected item that has already had a detrimental effect on the environment… Glitter. 

Although much loved as an art and craft favourite, glitter is a microplastic, just like microbeads.
attributes.additional_details:
We already know that 100% of mussels found off France and Belgium have ingested microplastics and many fish have too; so if you eat shell fish you more than likely have eaten microplastics too, along with the toxic additives that manufacturers use which are known to copy oestrogen, and affect human fertility. 

As responsible people looking after the next generation, the last thing we want to do is damaging the environment or risking their health, so we need to act now and stop this pollution.

attributes.action: To make the wearing of a cycle helmet compulsory when cycling on public roads.
attributes.background: The increase and popularity of cycling has exploded over the past few years and brought thousands of cyclists onto our crowded roads and into conflict with other road users. The potential for accidents has increased and the potential for fatal head injuries.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015, 18,844 cyclists were injured in reported road accidents, including 3,339 who were killed or seriously injured. (Source ROSPA)

attributes.action: To install defibrillator into all workplaces with 5 or more employees.
attributes.background:
I train first aid courses as my job and when I tell people that there is no definitive law about defibrillators in the workplace all I get is "why not? they would save more lives".

Within the UK sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) is one of the leading causes of premature death.
attributes.additional_details:
Electrical defibrillation is well established as an effective treatment for sudden cardiac arrest, and, if defibrillation is delivered within 3-5 minutes, survival rates can be as high as 50-70%.

The H&S (first aid) Regs 1981 states:
First aid provision must be ‘adequate and appropriate in the circumstances’. 

This to some employers is just a first aider and a first aid kit and I feel this is not enough, so I want to do more into making sure someone has the best chance of survival in an emergency.

attributes.action: Require all schools to have sprinklers fitted.
attributes.background: There are over 700 fires in schools per year but still they do not have sprinklers. Do we need a national tragedy before something happens?

attributes.action: Allow Term Time Holiday Requests during last week of Summer Term.
attributes.background: The law currently stands that students are not to be taken out of school during term time.  Why is it allowable for schools themselves to do this during the last week of the summer term for trips to Disneyland but not for parents? This is a double-standard.
attributes.additional_details:
A trip to Roman ruins in Paphos, the soon to be lost islands of the Maldives or Red Square in Moscow would be far more educational than a trip to Disneyland. However requests by parents to take children on holiday during the last week of the summer term are routinely denied yet schools offer our children non-educational elitist "trips".

The law needs to be changed to allow essential family time for holidays outside of the defined school holiday period. An open debate for a solution is needed.

attributes.action: Repeal the Resale Prices Act to reflect & protect high street retailing in 2017
attributes.background: The simplistic view of the 1964 RRP Act does not consider the damage caused by 'pop up' internet retailers & is clearly not in the long term public interest (requirement of the Act). The CMA enforcement of this ruling is forcing retailers to close, removing our conduit to consumer education & jobs!
attributes.additional_details:
"The UK supply chain supports 1,700 companies across a diverse lighting sector and is worth £2.3bn to the economy. The UK is home to more than 140 lighting design practices that specify lighting for mainly overseas projects and which present a unique opportunity for lighting manufacturers to access global markets.” Michael Fallon MP.

Jobs are being lost across the sector, training has almost ceased because retailers cannot make a living; this ACT must be urgently reviewed to save the industry.

attributes.action: Grant student mothers the same protections as working mothers
attributes.background: Higher education institutions are required under employment law to make maternity provisions for working mothers, yet there is no legal requirement ensuring the same protections for students who are mothers. This blind-spot has led to student mothers facing avoidable adversity in higher education.
attributes.additional_details:
In spite of the Equality Act 2010,  the rights of student mothers are primarily determined at their institution's discretion. Student mothers are easily marginalised and often squeezed out of the education system as a result.

Access to flexible working, maternity leave and breastfeeding facilities are examples of legal entitlements held by workers. There is no reason for student mothers not to be equally protected, when they are just as vulnerable to maternity discrimination. This must change.

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for criminals carrying out vehicle theft
attributes.background:
I recently went through the emotional torture of having my home broken into, my personal belongings rummaged through all in order to steal my 4 week old car from my driveway.
To say I'm heartbroken would be an understatement and anyone that has been through similar would understand these feelings.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the past 3 years, vehicle theft has increased by over 30%!! 40 police forces within England and Wales reported over 85,000 cases last year alone meaning the true figure is tremendously higher.
There is a lot of money in vehicle theft and with the sentence currently standing at 12 months (if charged as High Culpability), you can understand why its on the increase as the criminals feel untouchable

We demand that Vehicle Theft Criminals MUST face far tougher sentences

attributes.action: Restore Capital Punishment for terror offences.
attributes.background: With the increase in terrorist attacks and the threat of terrorism our country faces, it is time for the Government to restore Capital Punishment for those convicted of terror offences. Especially those who go on to cause injury or murder British citizens.

attributes.action: Create a Minister for Men that operates separately from the Minister for Women
attributes.background:
A 'Minister for Women (and Equalities)' cannot simultaneously be a 'Minister for Men' yet, that is what's in place.
Despite men raising issues in Parliament, men's issues are not raised.
A male-specific voice is required, equality demands it!
attributes.additional_details:
Such issues for the Minister for Men to address:
Paternity Rights (or, the lack of!)
Male Suicide (4x higher than female)
Homelessness (approx. 90% male)
Education (boys have been failing at every level since the 1990s)
Domestic Violence (40% victims are male)
False Allegations of Abuse
Disparity in health funding (prostate v breast cancer)
More information: https://ministerformen.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Make it law that airlines allow special assistance car seats on planes
attributes.background: Currently cabin crew have the discretionary power to reject a car seat, and therefore a disabled child their holiday or important trip. Children over the age of 2 may still need a car seat. Intellectual or physical disability can make a standard lap belt unsafe for travel. Make travel inclusive.
attributes.additional_details:
On a recent trip with my 5 year old son we were allowed to take our car seat right up to the plane steps. We were then told the seat and therefore my son were not allowed on the plane by the luggage loaders. When questioned it was explained and confirmed that it was at the discretion of the cabin crew.

Having booked time off, travelled to the airport, had special assistance how is it not law that disabled children be allowed on board with whichever equipment they need to make travel accessible

attributes.action: Allow same sex couples to both be on a birth certificate without being married
attributes.background: My partner and I are in a same-sex relationship and we wanted to have a baby. We couldn't afford private IVF and didn't want to use the NHS money when we could do it ourselves at home using a sperm donor. Baby born, now my partner isn't allowed on birth certificate because we weren't married.
attributes.additional_details: Because we didn't use a private clinic or the NHS and we weren't married at the time of conception my partner is unable to go on the birth certificate. She is now having to adopt our baby to get step parent rights instead of full parental rights, which is emotionally costly as well as financially. It now leaves our daughter's future uncertain should anything happen to me. In this day and age a birth certificate should state name of parents instead of gender specification.

attributes.action: Provide around-the-clock care and a 24/7 helpline for traumatised troops
attributes.background:
The Mail on Sunday is campaigning to ensure our brave soldiers no longer suffer in silence.
Our 'Helpline for Heroes' campaign calls on defence chiefs to set up a 24/7 helpline staffed by mental healthcare experts. It would cost just £2million.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1995, more than 400 serving UK troops have killed themselves while the number of personnel suffering from Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) has almost doubled since 2007 to 2,500 cases.
Yet, shockingly, the Government has cut back the provision of mental healthcare to the Armed Forces. Today, traumatised troops must rely on the NHS and charities for help outside office hours and at weekends.

attributes.action: Produce statutory guidance on how universities should support Dyslexic students.
attributes.background: Dyslexics learn differently. They are put at a disadvantage in today's educational system. Dyslexics should be given the same opportunity to reach their potential.
attributes.additional_details: I am dyslexic. I was lucky enough to receive a lot of support throughout my education. However, when I started university, my dyslexia became more apparent. I found it very difficult to learn from the teaching style. Moreover, the majority of my work was not marked in conjunction with my SPLD cover note. After speaking to my dyslexia help tutor, I learned that many lecturers do not believe in dyslexia. Therefore, the government should introduce statutory guidance to universities on how they can support dyslexic students. For example, by recommending compulsory seminars/training for staff.

attributes.action: Raise the tax threshold of Personal Allowance reduction to above £100,000
attributes.background: Currently, an individual’s Personal Tax Allowance reduces when annual income is above £100,000, by £1 for every £2 earned above this limit. This £100,000 limit has not been increased since its introduction in 2010-11.
attributes.additional_details: Whereas Personal Allowance values have almost doubled since the 2010-11 tax year (£6475 to £11500), the £100,000 earnings limit has not increased since introduction. Therefore, whilst Personal Allowances increase in line with the cost of living, the £100,000 earnings cap does not. Consequently, families of individuals earning over £100,000 are disadvantaged, with tax/child credits already abolished for any family earning over £50,000. The income limit for this PA reduction should be increased.

attributes.action: Debate the Whip system in the House of Commons for a major reform of the system.
attributes.background: A major reform of the whips system is essential to bring back meaningful debate to parliament.  The power of the whips inhibits democracy and encourages a herd instinct and mindlessly partisan behaviour. The power Whips currently hold encourages a lack of integrity and independent thought.
attributes.additional_details: The roles of the whips are secretive, but they appear to influence who sits on committees to question government ministers and having some say over who becomes chairman of the committee. They have too much power and too much say over what happens to MPs. Coercing, threatening or otherwise telling elected MPs how to vote should be outlawed. The notion of "whipping" members into the voting lobbies is yet another slap in the face of democracy and only benefits the party and executive branch.

attributes.action: Make vaccinations a requirement before a child can be enrolled in a school
attributes.background: At various stages throughout childhood, vaccines are administered to prevent fatal diseases that have killed millions of children in recorded history. They're vital to our survival and to those who cannot be immunised for medical reasons. Herd immunity only works if enough people are vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details: Earlier in 2017, the UK celebrated that measles had been eradicated in this country. This was hindered in the 90s by the work of (former Doctor) Andrew Wakefield. I accordance with WHO policy, 'eradicated' does not mean it was completely destroyed. It takes a 95% clearance to gain this status. There has, however, been a resurgence after the rise of the antivaxxer movement and foreign nationals entering the UK who carry such diseases. It takes one person to spread childhood disease.

attributes.action: The Government to pressure the Indian Government to release Jagtar Singh Johal
attributes.background: Jagtar Singh Johal from Dumbarton, West Dunbartonshire, had a sack thrown over his head and was forced into a van by plain-clothes officers on 4 November. The Police in Punjab secretly presented Jagtar Singh Johal before the duty magistrate without informing his family or legal counsel.
attributes.additional_details: Mr Johal, was in India since 2 October for his wedding. He was arrested by Punjab police on November 04 and was presented before a duty magistrate by the police on 05 November. The court had sent him on police remand until 10 November. His remand extension was secretly submitted to the magistrate court so that neither his family or legal counsel could plea against the extension before the magistrate. The lack of information being provided by the authorities is alarming. #freejagginow

attributes.action: Allow Tyler the Creator back into the UK
attributes.background:
Tyler, The Creator claims he has been banned from the UK.
The US rapper says he is not allowed to enter the country for "three to five years" because of lyrics he wrote in 2009.
The co-founder of hip-hop collective Odd Future has always attracted controversy.
attributes.additional_details: Freedom of speech is the right to articulate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship, or societal sanction. The term freedom of expression is sometimes used synonymously, but includes any act of seeking, receiving and imparting information or ideas, regardless of the medium used. This right has been incorporated into the Human Rights Act in 1998 and is still used today.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords/agents to discriminate against you for having pets
attributes.background:
Too many animals are put up for adoption because the landlord, letting agent and property managers won’t allow them in the homes they are letting.  
A sensible solution would be that tenants have to pay a ‘pet deposit’ which would cover any damages caused by animals living in the home.

attributes.action: Set a maximum premium level for car insurance.
attributes.background: Since the law requires any driver to be insured, there should be a legal maximum the insurers can charge for the annual premium with a basic cover that is acceptable by law.
attributes.additional_details: The government should ensure that a maximum charge is set giving the basic cover needed by law for full comprehensive and third party. The law requires drivers to be insured, the law should also state the maximum that can be charged for this service.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to publish pro-anorexia material online
attributes.background: Anorexia as well as bulimia and other eating disorders are killers. Pro-eating-disorder websites promote bad and dangerous habits –some of which have resulted in serious hospital treatment for me. Anyone can read these websites and be influenced!
attributes.additional_details: jodie_eats_to_live is my recovery account. We need accounts that are honest, and that show recovery and allow people to witness sufferers become so happy and positive! We need positivity and encouragement!

attributes.action: Asthmatics should get free inhalers
attributes.background: Asthma is a condition that affects millions across the UK. Many asthmatics are admitted to hospital each year due to asthma. Asthmatics are forced to spend a large sum of money each month on medication.  If diabetics can get insulin for free then why can't asthmatics get free inhalers?

attributes.action: Make self defence classes compulsory in schools.
attributes.background: With the rising rates of brutal and savage knife crimes, muggings and terror attacks in the UK, it is vital we begin educating the new generation on how to protect and defend themselves in panic situations.
attributes.additional_details:
An average of 65 people die from knife crime in the UK every year.
Pepper spray is banned in the UK, as are other self defence weapons. 
2017 has seen the biggest rise in terror attacks.

attributes.action: Force the chewing gum industry to pay for gum clean up costs - not the taxpayer
attributes.background: Local councils/taxpayers waste over £1million A WEEK to scrape chewing gum off our streets. The government must hold billionaire gum producers accountable for the huge costs their products inflict, and legally force them to pay for the clean up costs. Currently, they pay nothing towards these costs.
attributes.additional_details:
Local councils have faced 32% cuts in their budgets since 2010.  It's estimated that 2,000,000 blotches of gum are dropped on pavements every week in the UK, costing £1.50 to remove each black/white coloured blotch of gum.

A gum tax needs to be imposed on the sector to help offset the unsustainable and obscene costs that local Councils are currently having to bear - and which diverts scarce funding away from social care, housing and other essential local services.

attributes.action: Ban the use and selling of all aversive dog training equipment in the UK.
attributes.background:
Ban the use and selling of all aversive dog training equipment in the UK 

Prong collars / Pinch collar
Choke Collars
Shock collars / E Collars
Electric dog fence and door mats
attributes.additional_details:
In modern world science has given us the tools we need to train mans best friend without pain and fear. Using outdated training collars that causing pain and fear needs stopping.

It is now your turn to be your dogs best friend and put a stop to all aversive dog training equipment.

attributes.action: Abolish Parking Charges in hospital car parks!
attributes.background:
When people visit a hospital, they have to pay to park. Whilst parking for the disabled is free, everyone else has to pay.
People should not have to pay when they visit a hospital. This should apply to both patients and visitors. Abolish Hospital Parking Charges!

attributes.action: Legislate that cyclists & bicycles are tested, taxed, insured and registered.
attributes.background: The government must legislate to bring cyclists in line with other public road users. Therefore, cyclists should pay for and take a competency test, be issued with a license, be issued with two registration numbered Hi-Viz jackets, be insured and pay road tax.
attributes.additional_details: Following a recent death involving a bicycle, cyclist deaths caused by lack of awareness and continuing reports in the media of cyclists contravening red lights and pedestrian crossings, we must bring cycles under control and bring in a regime of culpability. If you want to cycle on public roads you should behave by and be governed by the rules and regulations of the road and you should pay for that priviledge, just as other road users have to.

attributes.action: Remove date of birth from the Companies House open register.
attributes.background:
Having recently been a victim of identity theft, it transpired they collected my contact details from the open Companies House register.

It appears easy to set up a credit account for online retailers using name, date of birth and address.

Leaving 3.9m company directors open to identity theft.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to petition the government to remove the date of birth field from the Companies House register in order to make it slightly harder for criminals to undertake simple identity theft such as this.

As cyber crime becomes more prevalent and larger businesses tighten their security, small and medium businesses (and their owners) will become an easier target.

attributes.action: Make targeted adverts in public spaces illegal.
attributes.background: The advertising billboards in Piccadilly Circus, for the first time ever, will show different adverts depending on what car you drive and how you look, by scrutinising you using cameras hidden in the screen.  This corporate assault on consensus reality has no place in our democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
References:

(1) https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23631483-400-giant-screen-in-piccadilly-circus-to-show-targeted-ads-based-on-cars/

(2)http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-4988764/New-screen-London-s-Piccadilly-Circus-track-people.html

(3)https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/personalised-ads-delivered-by-the-billboard-that-s-got-its-eye-on-you-hrxwrrb3z

(4) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telescreen

attributes.action: Teach life skills to students in secondary schools, e.g. managing money etc.
attributes.background: Our education system should be designed to equip school leavers for the world of work and beyond. Yet there are still many young people who don’t possess essential life skills including managing money, employment skills, managing mental health, LGBT inclusive sex education, first aid etc.

attributes.action: Put the university fee down to £6000. Not fair on students too much burden.
attributes.background: Once the students have achieved their target they start working. It's really hard for students to work, study, they pay for traveling, food and accommodation. Once they start work it's not fair on them to pay back loan with interest. If the fee goes down to £6000 it makes it little easier.

attributes.action: Mandatory CCTV in schools and nurseries!
attributes.background:
We have CCTV on buses , trains , shops for our own safety but no mandatory cctv in schools and nurseries for our children's safety. 

It will help parents know their kids are safe.
It will help prevent any type of children abuse.
It will help nursery management to review any accidents if needed.

attributes.action: Stop convicted  paedophiles from using the Internet for 5-10-Years
attributes.background:
Laws need to change when it comes to paedophilia.
Banning the Internet for these offenders restricts re offending.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my husband takes out our daughter and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! This means he either has to change her on the floor, bench or leave her until she gets home. This is not ideal.
attributes.additional_details:
There are so many more involved dads nowadays, diversification of families and opportunity of shared maternity leave. We need to make things more accessible for dads too!

Where changing facility are not in unisex toilets like disabled ones, i propose this be a legal requirement for these to be in both female and male toilets.

attributes.action: Close the 6 US military bases in the UK.
attributes.background: Magna Carta guarantees the removal of foreign forces following the restoration of peace. In 1942, after Japan attacked Hawaii, American forces established bases in the UK to fight Nazi Germany. In 1945 Adolf Hitler killed himself. On 8 October 2017 American forces still occupied 6 bases in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Magna Carta Clause (51) As soon as peace is restored, we will remove from the kingdom all the foreign knights, bowmen, their attendants, and the mercenaries that have come to it, to its harm, with horses and arms. https://militarybases.com/united-kingdom/ https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/magna-carta-english-translation

attributes.action: Establish baseline health monitoring for communities less than 3km from fracking
attributes.background:
Public Health England state about fracking:

'Baseline environmental monitoring is needed to facilitate the assessment of the impact of shale gas extraction on the environment and public health.'

Baseline health monitoring is equally essential to protect community health. Yet absent.
attributes.additional_details:
What is a health baseline?
It measures existing illness and potential future illness. Your current baseline has been shaped by your medical, social and family history and is constantly being influenced by your environment. 
Fracking has proven risk factors. 

Respiratory issues: https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamainternalmedicine/fullarticle/2534153

Pregnancy issues:
http://advances.sciencemag.org/content/3/12/e1603021

Other:
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0048969716325724

attributes.action: Parliament to debate meaning and functioning of democracy in Britain
attributes.background: The government’s reply to a petition calling for a referendum on any deal with the European Union misunderstands democracy, a process whereby nothing is set it stone. We want to hear, on behalf of the British people, what parliament thinks democracy is in Britain, and how it will uphold it.
attributes.additional_details: The reply says that there can be no attempt to reverse the result of a narrowly won, advisory referendum, as it is the will of the people.Yet the will of the people last June overturned a 2015 election and did not deliver a government majority. The petition was not calling for a second referendum on leaving the EU (which would be a third after 1975 and 2016) but a first referendum on the exit deal (it seems pointless to call for a debate on the DeXEUs reading and comprehension skills).

attributes.action: Make prescriptions for epipens free to anaphylaxis sufferers on the NHS
attributes.background: Vital life-saving drugs qualify for free prescriptions on the NHS, such as those that treat diabetes. Anaphylaxis sufferers have to carry an epipen throughout their life. This is undoubtedly a life-saving medication and should qualify to be on the exemption certificate for free prescriptions.

attributes.action: Prevent any money being paid to the EU from Britain after March 2019.
attributes.background: Theresa May has no mandate to pay the EU after March 2019. Her mandate is only to give the block notice of leaving, then follow through on the procedure. The vote of the people must be respected in full.

attributes.action: Make Fake Social Media Profiles Illegal
attributes.background: Fake profiles are used on Facebook, Instagram, dating websites and more. These profiles are currently used to abuse, stalk, harass, shame or harm real people emotionally and in some cases physically. People use these fake identities to disguise their own so they can get away with harmful behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: If fake profiles were made illegal there would be more discouragement to make one in the first place as the repercussions would be higher. I have personally been stalked, harassed, body shamed, and received vulgar bullying messages from one individual posing as multiple. There are enough public circumstances that have lead to physical attacks, assaults and self harm. Positive action needs to be made to prevent fake profiles as this should be considered criminal fraudulent activity. Thank You
